title: South India
hero_image_alt: Coconut-lined backwaters and temple gopurams at sunset
subtitle: Temples, Backwaters & Tropical Coasts
intro: South India is a tapestry of ancient temple architecture, lush backwaters, spice-scented coasts and hill stations wrapped in tea and coffee plantations. From classical dance and temple festivals to serene houseboat stays and coastal seafood, the region offers relaxed travel rhythms and deep cultural experiences. This page covers best times to visit, top experiences, cities and a curated photo gallery to give you a quick visual sense of the region.

best_time.off_season: May–Aug (hot and humid; monsoon in many areas)
best_time.notes: Winter months are ideal for coastal travel and temple visits; monsoon is perfect for backwaters if you prefer lush green landscapes.

top_experiences.title: Kerala Backwaters & Houseboats
top_experiences.summary: Serene houseboat cruises through canals and rice paddies.

top_experiences.title: Temple Architecture & Rituals
top_experiences.summary: Dravidian temples, elaborate gopurams and living ritual traditions.

top_experiences.title: Classical Arts & Dance
top_experiences.summary: Bharatanatyam, Carnatic music and temple festivals.

top_experiences.title: Hill Stations & Plantations
top_experiences.summary: Munnar, Coorg and Nilgiri tea/coffee landscapes.

top_experiences.title: Coastal Food Trails
top_experiences.summary: Seafood, coconut-based curries and coastal snacks.

top_experiences.title: Heritage Stays & Palaces
top_experiences.summary: Colonial bungalows, heritage homes and boutique resorts.

top_cities.title: Kochi
top_cities.summary: Historic port city with colonial forts, spice markets and vibrant arts scene.
top_cities.how_to_reach_snippet: Nearest airport: Kochi (COK) / Rail: Ernakulam Junction

top_cities.title: Chennai
top_cities.summary: Gateway to Tamil temple culture, classical music and Marina Beach.
top_cities.how_to_reach_snippet: Nearest airport: Chennai (MAA) / Rail: Chennai Central

top_cities.title: Bengaluru
top_cities.summary: Tech hub with gardened neighborhoods, craft breweries and nearby hill escapes.
top_cities.how_to_reach_snippet: Nearest airport: Bengaluru (BLR) / Rail: Bengaluru City

top_cities.title: Madurai
top_cities.summary: Ancient temple city known for the Meenakshi Amman Temple and ritual life.
top_cities.how_to_reach_snippet: Nearest airport: Madurai (IXM) / Rail: Madurai Junction

top_cities.title: Munnar
top_cities.summary: Tea hill station with rolling estates and cool climate.
top_cities.how_to_reach_snippet: Nearest airport: Cochin (COK) + road to Munnar

top_cities.title: Thiruvananthapuram
top_cities.summary: Kerala’s capital with access to Kovalam beaches and Ayurvedic treatments.
top_cities.how_to_reach_snippet: Nearest airport: Thiruvananthapuram (TRV) / Rail: Trivandrum Central

travel_tips: Carry light, breathable clothing for coastal days and a light layer for hill stations.
Respect temple customs: remove shoes and follow dress codes.
Book houseboats and hill-station stays in advance during peak season.
Try regional Ayurvedic treatments in Kerala with certified providers.

sample_itineraries.1-day: Kochi highlights: Fort Kochi walking tour, Jewish Synagogue, spice market and evening Kathakali performance.
sample_itineraries.3-day: Backwaters start in Alleppey: houseboat overnight, village walk, local seafood market visit.

logistics.typical_internal_transport: mix of trains and short domestic flights; private cars for hill stations
logistics.notes: Monsoon can affect travel times in coastal and hill routes; plan buffer days.
